answerText: Gauss' Law[10] Gauss' Law can be used to show that the electric field due to this configuration of charges is equal to the area charge density over two epsilon. This is usually calculated by drawing a perpendicular cylinder and noting the flux only goes through the end.
heading: Penn Bowl |2014 | 9 | 11 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This law can be used to show that the electric field within a thin conducting sphere is zero. For 10 points each: [10] Name this law which states that the flux through a surface surrounding a charge is proportional to the net electric charge enclosed by the surface.
